title: Complete Car Maintenance Checklist: Keep Your Vehicle Running Smoothly
author: Carlos Rodriguez
excerpt: Follow this comprehensive maintenance checklist to extend your car's life, improve safety, and avoid costly repairs down the road.
content:
Regular Maintenance Schedule

Follow your manufacturer's recommended maintenance schedule. Regular service prevents major issues and maintains warranty coverage.

Oil Changes

Change engine oil every 3,000-7,500 miles depending on your vehicle and oil type. Check oil level monthly and top off as needed.

Tire Care

Check tire pressure monthly, rotate tires every 5,000-7,500 miles, and inspect for wear patterns. Proper inflation improves fuel efficiency and safety.

Brake Inspection

Have brakes inspected annually. Listen for squealing or grinding noises and have brake pads replaced before they wear completely.

Fluid Checks

Regularly check engine coolant, brake fluid, power steering fluid, and windshield washer fluid. Top off or replace as needed.

Battery Maintenance

Clean battery terminals, check connections, and test battery voltage. Most batteries last 3-5 years depending on climate and usage.

Filter Replacements

Replace air filters, cabin air filters, and fuel filters according to schedule. Clean filters improve performance and fuel efficiency.
